intro: Garcinia balimensis, commonly known as the Balimeng Garcinia, is a tropical evergreen shrub native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Clusiaceae and is characterized by its glossy, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, fragrant yellow flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are rich in bioactive compounds, particularly hydroxycitric acid. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
